paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on BRCA2 variants, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 30-year-old woman was referred to a genetic service on account of her personal history of breast cancer at age 30 and family history of HBOC.

individual_records.phenotype_details: History of breast cancer diagnosed at age 32
individual_records.evidence_sentence: This condition had reportedly been diagnosed in her sister who had a history of breast cancer diagnosed at age 32.

functional_data.summary: The variant is classified as a variant of uncertain significance (VUS) and has not been reported before or reclassified since.

variants.segregation_data: The variant was not carried by all family members with breast cancer.
variants.additional_notes: Management should have been based on the family history of breast cancer, including the recommendation for close female relatives to commence breast surveillance.
key_quotes: The sister was recommended by her gynaecologist to have a risk-reducing bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy in view of the result.
A VUS result should not be the basis for this decision.

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted all relevant data regarding the BRCA2 variant mentioned in the paper.
